programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When 19-year-old Lori Auker left her Pennsylvania home for work and never arrived, it took space-age technology, cat hairs and insects to pinpoint the image of the woman's abductor.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When Russ Stager, a popular gym teacher, is found dead of what appears to be an accidental gunshot wound, his family becomes suspicious. They think his wife may have planned his murder. When police find that her previous husband died in questionable circumstances, they re-examine the crime scene and uncover evidence that the death was no accident.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: On the night of May 22, 1992, Betty Wilson returned home after a meeting. She walked up the stairs to the bedroom and discovered her husband, lying in a pool of blood. Jack Wilson had obviously been murdered... but how? And by whom? Even the experts couldn't agree.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1991, Robert Curley was diagnosed with Guillain_Barr_ syndrome when he arrived at the hospital with excruciating leg pains. However, doctors became suspicious during Robert's second admission and tested him for Thallium poisoning, which proved positive and Robert died shortly thereafter. Autopsy showed that Robert ingested more poison a few days before his death.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1980, Michigan resident Shannon Mohr died in what was reported to be a horseback riding accident by her new husband David Davis. After her death, Shannon's family reported to police their suspicions that Davis seemed far from grief-stricken.¾

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A Modesto, California teenager went missing. There was no sign of a struggle in her home, and police suspected she'd simply run away until her naked, bruised body was discovered in a ditch 20 miles away.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1993, the state of Florida was known for more than just Disney World. Worldwide attention focused on a rash of robberies which targeted tourists. Some vacationers were killed in these attacks, but some fought and survived, despite severe injuries.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An investigation into the murder of Katie Poirier is stymied by the lack of a body, but they find a few charred remains including a tooth. The tooth's filling contains unique properties that help investigators identify her remains. Further forensic evidence is then used to convict Donald Blom of her murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1984, California firefighters had battled ten arson fires in three weeks. When cigarettes and a scrap of paper connected the southern California fires to several fires further north, the hunt was on for a dangerous pyromaniac.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The story of firefighter Michelle Baker is related. After meeting Dr. Maynard Muntzing, she became pregnant by him. After this news, she was ill whenever they were together. The coincidences led her to suspect that he was doing her harm.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The investigation into the kidnapping and rape of an 18-year-old Ohio woman is aided when the victim returns hours after the incident occurred. With her help, the police are able to track the assailant Craig Bailey to his front door.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In the summer of 1986, Kathleen Lipscomb's body was found on a deserted road outside of San Antonio. Months passed, then years, and the crime was never solved. Then Kathleen's family hired a private investigator, who discovered her diary.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A teenager went missing after an evening of horseback riding. Her body was found a month later, three miles from her home. The killer unknowingly left trace evidence behind _ tiny but unmistakable clues which pointed to him and him alone.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When police recovered the submerged car of a man reported missing, they expected to find his body _ but it wasn't there. The investigation which followed would uncover an obsession turned deadly, and the motive for murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The decomposed body of a young woman was discovered in a Bakersfield irrigation canal. If there was trace evidence, it had been washed away.¾

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A young woman suddenly becomes critically ill, eventually leaving her unable to walk. A bone marrow test reveals the cause: arsenic. Investigators must determine if the poisoning was caused by groundwater contamination or something more sinister.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: No one in a quiet residential community saw anything unusual the day one of their neighbors was brutally attacked and murdered. Fingerprints found at the crime scene and surveillance video helped investigators to apprehend the presumed killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Computers aid the police and FBI in solving a string of crimes in St. Louis.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An obstetrician returned home from the hospital and found his wife on the bathroom floor. She was covered with blood and not breathing. He tried unsuccessfully to revive her, staining his clothes with her blood in the process, and then he called 911.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The investigation of the kidnapping of a prominent banker's wife led police on a wild goose chase. An unexpected discovery made by an entomologist led to a new suspect, and the realization that ordinary office equipment can leave extraordinary clues.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2002, a small community in upstate New York was devastated when Patty Wlasiuk died in a truck accident. But burdock seed pods found in her hair and on her clothes would indicate that this was no accident. It was cold-blooded murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An unusual case involving the 1988 rape and murder of Nancy DePriest. After Chris Ochoa confessed, the case was closed. 8 years later, Achim Marino confessed to the same crime. DNA evidence cleared Ochoa while proving that Marino was the perpetrator.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: For years, a woman suffered from what appeared to be the unpleasant side effects of lithium, a drug prescribed to treat bipolar disorder. When she died, investigators had to determine if her death was due to natural causes, suicide, or murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Using an anonymous letter and geographical profiling, investigators close in on a serial rapist.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The disappearance of a mail-order bride proves suspicious when detectives learn that two of the Texas husband's previous wives had died in mysterious circumstances.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The 3-year-old son of parents in Dripping Springs, Texas develops a respiratory condition. Then the father develops signs of Alzheimer's disease, and an investigator reveals that their ill health is due to a form of black mold in their modern home.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The police investigate when a severed leg is discovered in the garbage. Conventional means of identifying the victim are impossible, leading investigators to rely on DNA, forensic anthropology and toxicology to identify the victim.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The founder of American Atheists disappeared in 1995 along with one of her sons and granddaughter, along with $500,000 in gold coins. The police homed in on several suspects, including David R. Waters, who worked for American Atheists.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1991, a high school girl vanishes after attending a party. The prime suspect had not one but two alibi witnesses for the night she disappeared. A solid alibi can often overcome much circumstantial evidence. But forensic evidence is another matter.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A woman is found dead in a ravine, but crucial crime scene evidence had been washed away by severe thunderstorms. Twice, the trail turned cold. Almost 20 years later, an old hat and a chip of stainless steel brought the killer to justice.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a woman disappeared without a trace, there were two possible explanations: kidnapping or murder. Careful investigation, a forensic artist, and DNA profiling enabled police to find a single suspect, who was known to prey upon vulnerable women.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Hikers near Anchorage, Alaska discovered a body wrapped in sheets which were edged in orange stitching. Clinging to the sheet, they also discovered a tuft of red carpet fibers _ threads of evidence which led them straight to the killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: For seven years, a trio of men robbed one bank after another. They always got away before the police arrived, and they left no evidence behind. But the way they stood and the clothes they wore told a story that could be read by forensic scientists.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A Colorado hunter who'd been shot three times was the victim of a well planned crime. Investigators suspected two weapons and two killers. But analysis of the forensic evidence pointed them in a different direction--one much closer to home.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An employee of a dry cleaner was raped and murdered in the store. Police turned to forensic science for the answers they needed.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: After a street fight took the life of a national wrestling champion, police had to determine if he was killed in cold blood, or in self-defense. A jury decided it was murder, and sentenced the accused to a minimum of twenty years in prison.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Bombings are difficult to solve, because the perpetrator isn't usually at the scene, and the evidence goes up in smoke. In this case pieces of plastic the size of grains of sand hold the key to a man's murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In Pennsylvania 1984, a passer-by finds the torso of a woman in a cardboard box. Investigators rely on insect activity analysis by a forensic entomologist to determine when the murder victim was killed.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a man is gunned down in his own garage, police discover that a wound sustained by the grieving widow may have been self-inflicted. They turn to science to help unravel a twisted tale of lust, greed and deception.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The investigation into the apparent overdose suicide of Reverend Bill Guthrie's wife Sharon. Detectives suspect foul play after they recover incriminating files from Bill's computer and learn of his infidelity.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1988, the body of a young woman was discovered in an Ohio river. Most of the evidence had been washed away, but the victim's 6 year-old son unwittingly told investigators all they needed to know...without saying a word. The clue was in his genes.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Using an anonymous letter and geographical profiling, investigators close in on a serial rapist.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A young couple decided to celebrate their first wedding anniversary with a camping trip to Mount Hood. During the trip, the husband was shot and killed, and his wife told two different versions of the events which led to his death.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a man is gunned down in his own garage, police discover that a wound sustained by the grieving widow may have been self-inflicted. They turn to science to help unravel a twisted tale of lust, greed and deception.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Doctors cannot pinpoint the source of a businessman's illness.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Armed with little else, police hoped the shoe impressions found at a Lansing, Michigan crime scene would put their investigation of Audrey Nichols' murder back on track.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Forensics hopes to determine if this was revenge when the home of a state's witness is bombed, killing his father.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The body of a young woman was found under an isolated ramp of the Interstate, and a tiny, unique fiber on the victim's clothing led San Diego police straight to the most unlikely of killers.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: It was 1957, and California police were searching for a man who had committed several crimes in one night, including murder. They followed thousands of leads but eventually the case turned cold. Almost 50 years later, with the help of advances in computer technology and handwriting analysis, investigators proved an old adage: You can run, but you can't hide.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A young woman suddenly becomes critically ill, eventually leaving her unable to walk. A bone marrow test reveals the cause: arsenic. Investigators must determine if the poisoning was caused by groundwater contamination or something more sinister.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Investigators sift through the ashes of a fire which killed a 40-year-old woman. The fire appeared to have been started by an unattended cigarette. On closer look, forensic scientists discover the cause was far more complicated.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When an elderly couple died in a suspicious house fire, their son became the prime suspect. Investigators turned to forensic science to determine if the fire had been set deliberately, or if it was an unfortunate accident.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When the head chef of a historic Philadelphia restaurant was found dead, investigators interviewed the usual suspects: family, friends and coworkers. As they sifted through the evidence, police uncovered a chilling tale of debt and deceit.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A college student was found dead, and the evidence suggested he knew his killer. Three hairs and some microscopic cells helped police to unravel a web of lies, and find the motive for murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When police recovered the submerged car of a man reported missing, they expected to find his body _ but it wasn't there. The investigation which followed would uncover an obsession turned deadly, and the motive for murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A Colorado hunter who'd been shot three times was the victim of a well planned crime. Investigators suspected two weapons and two killers. But analysis of the forensic evidence pointed them in a different direction--one much closer to home.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Bombings are difficult to solve, because the perpetrator isn't usually at the scene, and the evidence goes up in smoke. In this case pieces of plastic the size of grains of sand hold the key to a man's murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A young TV news producer is raped and murdered in her apartment. Police identify two suspects, but both are cleared of any wrongdoing. The case stalls for more than a year, and then investigators turn to the Commonwealth of Virginia's DNA Databank.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1991, when the wife of a serviceman was brutally murdered in the Philippines, investigators had to reassemble a 5-1/4 inch computer disk which had been cut to pieces with pinking shears in order to find the killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The investigation into the apparent overdose suicide of Reverend Bill Guthrie's wife Sharon. Detectives suspect foul play after they recover incriminating files from Bill's computer and learn of his infidelity.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An obstetrician returned home from the hospital and found his wife on the bathroom floor. She was covered with blood and not breathing. He tried unsuccessfully to revive her, staining his clothes with her blood in the process, and then he called 911.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When an elderly couple died in a suspicious house fire, their son became the prime suspect. Investigators turned to forensic science to determine if the fire had been set deliberately, or if it was an unfortunate accident.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The founder of American Atheists disappeared in 1995 along with one of her sons and granddaughter, along with $500,000 in gold coins. The police homed in on several suspects, including David R. Waters, who worked for American Atheists.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An investigation into the murder of Katie Poirier is stymied by the lack of a body, but they find a few charred remains including a tooth. The tooth's filling contains unique properties that help investigators identify her remains. Further forensic evidence is then used to convict Donald Blom of her murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Two eyewitnesses may hold the key to the death of a motorcycle gang member.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When police recovered the submerged car of a man reported missing, they expected to find his body _ but it wasn't there. The investigation which followed would uncover an obsession turned deadly, and the motive for murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A married couple decided to escape the cold of winter with a mini-vacation in Key West. The wife went missing, and police searched every square inch of the island; they found nothing but a pair of sandals which might have belonged to her.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: After a man's body is discovered a few miles from his home, police trace the crime back to his wife.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A police officer accused of killing his estranged wife insists she committed suicide. Investigators say it was murder¾_ that it was physically impossible for the woman to have shot herself.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The disappearance of a mail-order bride proves suspicious when detectives learn that two of the Texas husband's previous wives had died in mysterious circumstances.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The investigation into a brutal attack on two boys near a pond relies on evidence fished out of the murky water. It was the first case where Diatom evidence was used to place a suspect at the scene of the crime.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Investigators sift through the ashes of a fire which killed a 40-year-old woman. The fire appeared to have been started by an unattended cigarette. On closer look, forensic scientists discover the cause was far more complicated.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A 29-year-old woman was killed instantly when a bomb exploded in her home. The device was so powerful that shrapnel was embedded in houses across the street. The bomber had not only knowledge and skill, but also a motive for murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A 34-year-old nurse experiences a variety of flu-like symptoms. None of her doctors are able to discover the cause, until she visits the gynecologist for a routine check-up. Then she learns it's something far worse than the flu.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A patrol officer is shocked by the amount of blood at a traffic accident and is shocked by the coroner's ruling until an anonymous phone call re-ignites the case.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A young woman was found dead on a golf course in the Bahamas. The grass on that course was so distinctive, it had evidentiary value. The evidence led police to two suspects. Each blamed the other, and they had to find out who the killer was.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A beautiful young woman fell to her death from a cliff overlooking the ocean. Initially, investigators thought it was a tragic accident. But after a forensic examination, police had a very different picture of what happened.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Three seemingly unrelated deaths proved to be serial murders. The killer had been careful _ he used poison which had no taste or odor. Fortunately for investigators, it also had a unique chemical signature.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A woman is found dead in a ravine, but crucial crime scene evidence had been washed away by severe thunderstorms. Twice, the trail turned cold. Almost 20 years later, an old hat and a chip of stainless steel brought the killer to justice.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Hikers near Anchorage, Alaska discovered a body wrapped in sheets which were edged in orange stitching. Clinging to the sheet, they also discovered a tuft of red carpet fibers _ threads of evidence which led them straight to the killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a pipe bomb ripped through a rural home, police had no idea who was responsible. A lot number on a 9-volt battery and the remnants of a mailing label found on a hard drive led investigators to who sent the bomb and why.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A two-man shrimp boat sank when a fast-moving, violent storm struck the Louisiana coast. The captain drowned, and the deckhand was rescued fourteen hours later. The deckhand was considered a hero until the captain's body was found.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The sensitive nose of a forensic examiner sniffs out murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: It was 1957, and California police were searching for a man who had committed several crimes in one night, including murder. They followed thousands of leads but eventually the case turned cold. Almost 50 years later, with the help of advances in computer technology and handwriting analysis, investigators proved an old adage: You can run, but you can't hide.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1993, the Amtrak Railroad experienced the deadliest train crash in United States history when the Sunset Limited derailed while crossing Alabama's Big Bayou Canot bridge. Forty-seven passengers and crew were killed; scores more were injured.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The police investigate when a severed leg is discovered in the garbage. Conventional means of identifying the victim are impossible, leading investigators to rely on DNA, forensic anthropology and toxicology to identify the victim.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A woman disappears without a trace. Even though foul play is suspected, the leads don't pan out and the trail turns cold. Twenty years would pass before police are able to link a clump of hair discovered in an isolated area with the missing woman.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a woman disappeared without a trace, there were two possible explanations: kidnapping or murder. Careful investigation, a forensic artist, and DNA profiling enabled police to find a single suspect, who was known to prey upon vulnerable women.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Just weeks before a witness is to testify against the man accused of sexually assaulting her, she is murdered in the front yard of her own home. Investigators immediately suspect her attacker, but they don't have enough evidence to prove his guilt.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: After a man's body is discovered a few miles from his home, police trace the crime back to his wife.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A healthy young man dies mysteriously in his sleep, and toxicology tests reveal a lethal dose of lidocaine in his blood. Investigators find a suicide note, and presume he killed himself until a forensic linguist examines the note.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Forensics hopes to determine if this was revenge when the home of a state's witness is bombed, killing his father.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: For years, a woman suffered from what appeared to be the unpleasant side effects of lithium, a drug prescribed to treat bipolar disorder. When she died, investigators had to determine if her death was due to natural causes, suicide, or murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: How scientists solved a 1992 murder case involving cremation. It takes a long time and a very hot fire to cremate a human body, and thus destroy evidence of foul play. But the coroner who performed the autopsy on the body found telltale clues.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Authorities track a kidnapper who allowed his victim, 17-year-old Shari Smith, to write a last will and testament on a note pad, then informed the family of her murder, as well as the later murder of a 10-year-old Debra May Helmick. A phone number written on a previous page left a lasting impression, which helped to convict Larry Gene Bell.

programme.title: Atlanta Homicide
programme.desc: On a hot summer night in early August, two assailants attempt to rob a man’s house, who is rumored to have a great deal of cash within his house. programme.title: Fatal Attraction-Dupe
programme.desc: Lilius Landrum was a woman of faith with a heart of gold, but on the brink of success fate takes a horrible turn when her body is discovered in the basement of her apartment. programme.title: Sins of the City
programme.desc: By 1998, Jasper is one of the most racially progressive small towns in east Texas. But the dragging death of James Byrd Jr. by three white supremacists reveals hidden racial divisions and makes Jasper�s name forever synonymous with murder and hate.

programme.title: Sins of the City
programme.desc: Newark may be one of America�s oldest and most diverse cities, but it�s also one of the most dangerous. And in 2007, the violent attacks of four college students by a ruthless gang of teenage killers would prove just how deadly the city could be.

programme.title: Find Our Missing
programme.desc: Unique Harris, 24-year-old mother of two young boys, disappears from her southeast D.C. apartment in the middle of the night. Morgan Johnson, 27-year old man from Plainfield, IN was last seen on surveillance camera leaving his hotel around midnight.

programme.title: Payback
programme.desc: Two months after a man is acquitted of a murder, he too becomes a victim of gun violence. While police are convinced the shooting was revenge, they and the rest of the community are shocked to learn his own cousin helped lure him to his death.

programme.title: Payback
programme.desc: After a young man with a criminal record is shot and killed in broad daylight, investigators have to figure out if the shooting was random, or if his death may have been the work of a player from his troubled past intent on payback.

programme.title: Fatal Attraction-Dupe
programme.desc: The disappearance of a young mother and her three-year-old son turns a small southern town upside-down. Family members are quick to suspect foul play has befallen this devoted mother of two, and as night falls with no sign of their return, the community bands together in the search effort. Will rescuers be able to reach them in time or will it be too late?

programme.title: Fatal Attraction-Dupe
programme.desc: When a retired Chicago steelworker is gunned down outside his home, police suspect he was targeted by a street gang in retaliation for reporting crimes in the neighborhood. programme.title: For My Man
programme.desc: Teen mom Ashley Owens struggles to make ends meet in Charlotte, North Carolina until she falls for a bad boy with a plan for some easy cash. programme.title: For My Man
programme.desc: When the bodies of a missing couple surface in the waters of New Orleans, detectives wonder who could have committed this heinous crime. Their investigation leads them to a young woman who was so desperate, she�d do anything for her man.

programme.title: Fatal Attraction-Dupe
programme.desc: When a Ka’Loni Flynn ends up dead on a rural road, investigators wonder if she’s the victim of a car jacking gone wrong, or something far more sinister. But whoever committed this horrific crime left no evidence behind, making it look like the perfect crime.

programme.title: Fatal Attraction-Dupe

programme.title: Bloomberg Originals
programme.desc: Bloomberg Originals offers bold takes for curious minds on today’s biggest topics. Exploring every angle of climate change, technology, finance, sports and beyond, Bloomberg Originals is business as you’ve never seen it.

programme.title: Deserts
programme.desc: Host Philippe Cousteau visits the Mohave Desert, and discovers how varied deserts can be; some deserts are covered with sand dunes, while others have amazing vegetation. We also travel to Death Valley, the hottest spot in North America. Then we explore the Joshua Tree National Park, which has the unusual Joshua tree, and many other exotic plants.

programme.title: Canyons
programme.desc: Host Philippe Cousteau travels to the Grand Canyon by helicopter, and gives us a close look at this amazing canyon, which is considered one of the seven natural wonders of the world. We'll also visit Bryce Canyon and its fascinating "hoodoos," which are rock formations sculpted by weather. We'll also dive into the Monterrey Bay and discover an incredible underwater canyon that features some unusual sea creatures.

programme.title: Photowalks On Scripps News
programme.desc: Join former USA TODAY columnist Jefferson Graham as he brings viewers to the planet's most photographable places, takes them on a virtual photowalk and offers tips on getting great vacation photos with your phone.

programme.title: Rt 66: Oklahoma
programme.desc: A Photowalk along historic Route 66 continues in Oklahoma, where Jefferson Graham takes you to some of the most beautiful and unique places to explore.

programme.title: Beyond Cold
programme.desc: The human body is a wonderfully complex machine and scientists are only beginning to understand why some humans can survive extremely low temperatures.

programme.title: Apocalypse 101
programme.desc: Could you find a way to survive in a post-apocalyptic world? Explore what it would take to stay alive following a global cataclysm, and what knowledge we would need to rebuild civilization as we know it.

programme.title: Saving The Right Whale
programme.desc: The North Atlantic Right Whale is on the verge of extinction. The leading experts and biologists who are racing to save this species reveal the breakthroughs needed to save the whale.

programme.title: Forecasting The Big One
programme.desc: Earthquakes can leave a path of destruction with no warning. Through the latest technology, scientists are scrambling for a breakthrough that can forecast where and when earthquakes will strike next.

programme.title: Operation Cockfight: Underworld Gambling
programme.desc: Stan Sales of the Honolulu PD enters the world of cockfighting, a popular entertainment on the island. Sales and his partners go undercover to videotape and document a local promotor who controls the cockfights and takes a piece of all the action. They eventually arrest the promoter and shut down his illegal operation for good.

programme.title: Operation Bank Robbery: Breaking The Bank
programme.desc: Ken Dye goes undercover for the St. Louis County Sheriff's Department to purchase illegal weapons and hears about a planned bank heist. He is hired to help the would-be bank robbers stick up a local bank. But Dye discovers that the mastermind plans to enact vengeance for being refused a loan, and kill the bank president. Dye plays along to gather evidence against the criminals and arrest them before they go rogue and pull the job without him.

programme.title: Operation Canned Tomatoes: Italian Mafia
programme.desc: FBI agent Ron Moretti enters the dangerous world of the Italian mafia, while investigating the supply of heroin into the US. Moretti devises a plan to have the mafia ship their white powder inside canned tomatoes, but the FDA blocks the plan because of their culinary concerns. During the two-year long operation, Moretti becomes the shipping point of Italian heroin, while dodging international governments before taking the traffickers down.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: Crimes exploiting online generosity are a growing trend. These real-life stories show people going to great lengths to con unsuspecting donors out of their money.

programme.title: Lost Innocence: The Tragedy of Harmony Montgomery
programme.desc: A police investigation into a missing seven-year-old girl in Manchester, New Hampshire reveals harrowing details that shock the state. But even more disturbing is the discovery that the tragic outcome could have been avoided.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: Sierra Lamar leaves for school one morning and vanishes with barely a trace, setting in motion one of the largest searches in U.S. history. The community and investigators still have unanswered questions.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: Known as one of the first cases of the digital age, Maura Murray's mysterious disappearance continues to confound investigators and internet sleuths.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: It's the day after Thanksgiving 1992 in Drake, Iowa, and few want to cook. Locals head to the popular Drake Diner instead. In front of a packed restaurant, an armed man shoots and kills two diner employees. Is the town as peaceful as some say?

programme.title: On The Job
programme.desc: Brendan dodges the fangs of venomous snakes, suits up to wrangle bees and sell local honey, and dives headfirst into protecting the future of Florida's coral reefs.

programme.title: Stitch
programme.desc: From longboards to wool sweaters, these amazing creators make beautiful, functional pieces of art.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: Sometimes the bad guys are busted by regular people! These stories showcase good Samaritans stopping suspects in their tracks.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: Three-year-old Kamille McKinney, affectionately known as "Cupcake," is abducted while playing outside a relative's Birmingham home. The ensuing search unifies the city, as residents pray she will be found alive.

programme.title: Wait, What Happened?
programme.desc: Frank Nicotero is in Cincinnati asking locals questions about wild and wacky news stories that include some unbelievable weddings, kissing creatures and a swimming pool surprise.

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.desc: Camryn Simpson, a 21-year-old student at the University of Pittsburgh and ambassador on social media platforms can’t take time away from her phone. With the help of Kinga, Camryn will log-out of social media and log-in to the outdoors to find adventure.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: Find out why they call them 'yum yums,' make a toast in the Bourbon Capital of the World and follow the clues on a murder mystery train. Want to spend the night with a spector? Stay the night in a former jail that's now a haunted B&B.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: Whether it’s hot chicken or gas station pad thai, the Magic City offers plenty of ways to make good things disappear.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: Former teacher Craig Falk is hitting the (cook)books against former lawyer Laurie Boucher. Which of these second-career chefs best showcases their culinary skills to craft the perfect packed lunch?

programme.title: Boston Rob Does Beantown
programme.desc: Rob discovers amazing antiques, grills some top-notch steak, tours an animal shelter and serves drinks in one of Boston’s poshest neighborhoods.

programme.title: Ballin' in Baltimore
programme.desc: Angel captures a different angle on Baltimore with activist and photojournalist, Devin Allen. They explore street photography, pop wheelies with a cutting-edge community dirt biking program and enjoy Charm City's most decadent treats.

programme.title: Stitch
programme.desc: Celebrating veterans, acknowledging their service and sacrifices

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.desc: After receiving an email from an 11 year old girl the guys jump into action to help her single mother of 4 furnish their new apartment. Justin quickly realizes they need more help than he anticipated, and now must scramble to fulfill his promise.

programme.title: Absolutely Albuquerque
programme.desc: Amanda takes in Albuquerque from a whole new angle with Talin Marked owner, Victor Limay. Together, they experience new flavors, make friends with the city's dynamic makers, and elevate their perspectives on what makes the Duke City so unique.

programme.title: Local Love
programme.desc: Luke is a Kansas City bachelor who is finally ready to settle down. He’s purging the dating apps and hoping to find the perfect match. He’ll meet three blind dates as they play pickleball, get their shuffleboard on and visit a llama farm.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: You can run. You can hide. But chances are, they’re still gonna find you. These are some of the wildest and most bizarre police captures on record.

programme.title: WXII Local News
programme.desc: Get the latest news and weather from WXII.

programme.title: West By Orphan Train
programme.desc: A gripping documentary uncovering real stories of children loaded on trains, sent west, and presented “for the picking.” From 1854 to 1929, over 6,000 children landed in Iowa communities. Discover their emotional journeys and impact on the Midwest.

programme.title: Only In
programme.desc: Every city has its own local flavor, culture and vibe. Only In celebrates communities across America and the people, activities and history that make each place unique. From must-try activities to hidden gems and hotspots, to dedicated changemakers, these stories are sure to inspire a deeper love and appreciation for your hometown and beyond.

programme.title: The Spark
programme.desc: From professional hockey players to award-winning muralists, The Spark highlights the craft, the journey, and the joy. These masters and thought leaders may have made names for themselves on the national stage, but they never forget the city that sparks their inspiration daily

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: Experience serious vacation vibes and discover some of the most special corners of America on this guided tour of must-visit cities.

programme.title: Ed & Day in The 'Burgh
programme.desc: Comedians, podcasters and craft beer enthusiasts Ed Bailey and Day Bracey explore hot spots, hidden gems and the best places to grab a cold brew in the 'Burgh.

programme.title: Heroes On Call
programme.desc: In the 1960s, Americans were dying at shocking rates due to inadequate emergency care. Enter Freedom House Ambulance Service: the first paramedics unit in the U.S., run and staffed by Black men and women. This is the origin story of EMS.

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.desc: Join New Hampshire-based band Recycled Percussion as they perform acts of kindness in their community, and across the country. In each episode, you'll witness the great lengths and hilarious things they're willing to do in the name of kindness.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: Chefs recreate each other’s signature dish, but they can only determine what the dish is using their senses of taste, touch and smell. When the masks come off, the heat is on, with each chef attempting to cook their opponent’s creation.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: A true crime series telling the story of unfathomable crimes that have rocked American communities leaving them forever changed.

programme.title: Only In
programme.desc: Where can you find a Neurodiverse Universe, a sidewalk juggling optimist, and free fresh veggies? The same place where pollinators are prioritized and where records get their grooves.

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.desc: It's cuteness overload at a rescue farm for disabled animals and Justin's donation makes a huge difference. The guys roll out trivia bowling for Winston-Salem locals, sparking tons of laughs. Jimmy Luv kindly hides cash for lucky strangers to find.

programme.title: Only In
programme.desc: Where can you find a vintage scooter delivering burritos and a seafood market with the freshest catch in town? The same place with repurposed vending machines dispensing unique art and wedding dresses made into hand-crafted heirlooms.

programme.title: Julia Tries Everything

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: Watch things heat up in the kitchen as two local chefs go head-to-head to create a three-course meal utilizing ingredients sourced from one of the city’s unique marketplaces.

programme.title: Local Love

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness

programme.title: Maker Nation Challenge

programme.title: Completed Episodes
programme.desc: Indulge in the old-school classics that have reigned in the Midwest for decades. From Wisconsin cheese curds to Kansas City's burnt ends, enjoy these unique comfort foods that are as timeless as they are tasty.

programme.title: My Perfect Day
programme.desc: Chris has an unstoppable spirit, despite the challenges of Down syndrome. His resilience has propelled him to extraordinary achievements, including clinching the gold in Greece. Meaghan takes him on a whirlwind of experiences tailored just for him.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: From a 300-year-old violin valued at $6 million, to thousands of rare books, thieves will go to wild, even dangerous, lengths to snatch up irreplaceable treasures. For investigators, it's a race against the clock to recover these priceless valuables.

programme.title: Free Spirit

programme.title: Americas Most Delish

programme.title: Sports Town Stories
programme.desc: Each episode of this documentary series features incredible sports stories from iconic American cities. From gritty underdog victories to passionate unlikely match-ups, the series proves that sports are so much more than a pastime.

programme.title: Completed Episodes
programme.desc: Scott's life revolves around everyone's favorite four-legged friends, from rescuing and caring for countless dogs, his spirit is unwavering. Today Meaghan gives back a day full of moments for him and his beloved canine companion.

programme.title: Only In
programme.desc: Every city has its own local flavor, culture and vibe. Only In celebrates communities across America and the people, activities and history that make each place unique. From must-try activities to hidden gems and hotspots, to dedicated changemakers, these stories are sure to inspire a deeper love and appreciation for your hometown and beyond.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: Watch things heat up in the kitchen as two local chefs go head-to-head to create a three-course meal utilizing ingredients sourced from one of the city’s unique marketplaces.

programme.title: Heroes On Call
programme.desc: In the 1960s, Americans were dying at shocking rates due to inadequate emergency care. Enter Freedom House Ambulance Service: the first paramedics unit in the U.S., run and staffed by Black men and women. This is the origin story of EMS.

programme.title: Salute to Heroes
programme.desc: (2023) WXII and the Triad CW recognize the 2023 American Red Cross "Salute to Heroes" recipients of the Triad.

programme.title: Weathering the Storm

programme.title: Arctic Animals
programme.desc: In this episode, we'll feature animals that live in the freezing arctic. Learn how the Polar Bear has developed special adaptations that help it survive in the most unforgiving climate imaginable. And why the Wolverine is able to hunt so efficiently in the snow.

programme.title: Man's Best Friend
programme.desc: In this episode, we examine the science behind man's best friend - the dog. Find out what makes a greyhound so fast. See how a bloodhound's nose really works, and the reason that border collies are so intelligent is revealed.

programme.title: Deserts
programme.desc: Host Philippe Cousteau visits the Mohave Desert, and discovers how varied deserts can be; some deserts are covered with sand dunes, while others have amazing vegetation. We also travel to Death Valley, the hottest spot in North America. Then we explore the Joshua Tree National Park, which has the unusual Joshua tree, and many other exotic plants.

programme.title: Canyons
programme.desc: Host Philippe Cousteau travels to the Grand Canyon by helicopter, and gives us a close look at this amazing canyon, which is considered one of the seven natural wonders of the world. We'll also visit Bryce Canyon and its fascinating "hoodoos," which are rock formations sculpted by weather. We'll also dive into the Monterrey Bay and discover an incredible underwater canyon that features some unusual sea creatures.

programme.title: Photowalks On Scripps News
programme.desc: Join former USA TODAY columnist Jefferson Graham as he brings viewers to the planet's most photographable places, takes them on a virtual photowalk and offers tips on getting great vacation photos with your phone.

programme.title: Rt 66: Oklahoma
programme.desc: A Photowalk along historic Route 66 continues in Oklahoma, where Jefferson Graham takes you to some of the most beautiful and unique places to explore.

programme.title: Beyond Cold
programme.desc: The human body is a wonderfully complex machine and scientists are only beginning to understand why some humans can survive extremely low temperatures.

programme.title: Apocalypse 101
programme.desc: Could you find a way to survive in a post-apocalyptic world? Explore what it would take to stay alive following a global cataclysm, and what knowledge we would need to rebuild civilization as we know it.

programme.title: Saving The Right Whale
programme.desc: The North Atlantic Right Whale is on the verge of extinction. The leading experts and biologists who are racing to save this species reveal the breakthroughs needed to save the whale.

programme.title: Forecasting The Big One
programme.desc: Earthquakes can leave a path of destruction with no warning. Through the latest technology, scientists are scrambling for a breakthrough that can forecast where and when earthquakes will strike next.

programme.title: Operation Cockfight: Underworld Gambling
programme.desc: Stan Sales of the Honolulu PD enters the world of cockfighting, a popular entertainment on the island. Sales and his partners go undercover to videotape and document a local promotor who controls the cockfights and takes a piece of all the action. They eventually arrest the promoter and shut down his illegal operation for good.

programme.title: Operation Bank Robbery: Breaking The Bank
programme.desc: Ken Dye goes undercover for the St. Louis County Sheriff's Department to purchase illegal weapons and hears about a planned bank heist. He is hired to help the would-be bank robbers stick up a local bank. But Dye discovers that the mastermind plans to enact vengeance for being refused a loan, and kill the bank president. Dye plays along to gather evidence against the criminals and arrest them before they go rogue and pull the job without him.

programme.title: Operation Canned Tomatoes: Italian Mafia
programme.desc: FBI agent Ron Moretti enters the dangerous world of the Italian mafia, while investigating the supply of heroin into the US. Moretti devises a plan to have the mafia ship their white powder inside canned tomatoes, but the FDA blocks the plan because of their culinary concerns. During the two-year long operation, Moretti becomes the shipping point of Italian heroin, while dodging international governments before taking the traffickers down.

programme.desc: Joanne Takasato has no experience in uniform or on the streets of Honolulu. She's intimidated and threatened by the cop, and even her supervisor is jealous of her success on the streets.

programme.title: Operation Canned Tomatoes: Italian Mafia
programme.desc: FBI agent Ron Moretti enters the dangerous world of the Italian mafia, while investigating the supply of heroin into the US. Moretti devises a plan to have the mafia ship their white powder inside canned tomatoes, but the FDA blocks the plan because of their culinary concerns. During the two-year long operation, Moretti becomes the shipping point of Italian heroin, while dodging international governments before taking the traffickers down.
